intro: Calymmanthera filiformis, commonly known as the slender calymmanthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
